author: Tevo
title: PCDiscord Miro board for Onboarding
description: It takes time to maintain and moderate a large Discord channel

assessments.note: This proposal gives a good overview for the discord features and information that is on the discord. When i look at the campaign, we have to have a central place to store information and keep all the information updated
As an added value, the miro board could help in onboarding users and foster faster participation.
assessments.reply: Says it good and adds value. Doesnt say why and gives middle score which gives impression that it could be made half better

assessments.note: The problem and the solution are clear, objective and the proposal is within the scope of the challenge. The proposal can help people navigate through the Catalyst server on Discord more easily, significantly improving the onboarding process.
The miro boards are a great support for onboarding new members and also for developing new ideas in general. Preparing and Maintaining does cause effort and should be supported.

Properly integrating new members into the process and the channel seems like a good idea though it seems a bit costly to spend 900 USD to create material mostly explaining basic discord functionalities. Maybe it would be more appropriate to provide already existing tutorials and on top of them produce material to explain the structure of the PC Discord channel?

This is an excellent initiative that could bring a lot of value to the community. The need of such a schematic has been brought up by the community innumerous times, and I believe this would address it very well. The only 'con' I see is that most people don't know Miro, and the amount of information could make it to run slower on some machines, and it's not mobile friendly. I would suggest to have an alternative, even it's a summary only, in other format, like PDF or something more known.
This plan is really doable and can serve as a short term solution. This idea is defenatly quickly implementable.

The team is already involved in the Catalyst community and participates in projects to improve Catalyst, such as participation by Swarm Sessions, Landing Page and documentation. The team has already developed a good part of the work and there is a lot of information and details on the Miro board, so the team's ability to execute the proposal is clear. I recommend only including more details of the team in the proposal, so that the community that does not know them has access to this.

There is no description of budget breakdown in the proposal and I also did not find it on the Miro board, there is also no description of the workload so that it is possible to understand the feasibility. From what I checked on the Miro board and the intention I think the requested budget is reasonable, but including details is essential.
i could see myself using the setup and use of miro-board as a tool for support. Tevo did an excellent job. I have no doubt that it will be successfully implemented.
The proposers seem to know their way around Discord and visualizing things, so they should be perfectly equipped to perform the task.
The proposal is completely feasible and the proposer is already engaged in developing the solution and engaged with the community. There is no risk that this proposal won't be delivered.
This propasal is easy to implement, but i can't findinformation how effective this could be. Maybe adding a tracable clickpath would prove the effectiveness.

While the initial creation seems feasible, apparent issues (e.g. fragmentation of knowledge base, managing changes across multiple platforms) is not addresses. It is also not clear that the miro board and videos about discord usage would make things easier and better.

Discord is only one communication platform among the Cardano community and the proposal may have significant less reach and effect as anticipated by the proposer.

There is a clear description of the problem, the solution and how the proposal addresses the challenge in a relevant way, but there are no budget breakdowns, KPIs and metrics to audit the proposal.

A 3-month timeline has been established for the delivery of Miro board tutorials, but there is no mention of the videos. There are no details about the proposers' experience.

It is important to note that the work is already in progress and this is a point in favor of auditability, as there is already delivery before funding.

the proposal only provides a roadmap for the first three month and no spectific milestones after that BUT it is a relatively small proposal regarding requested funds and task that needs to be done. There is no need for more details.

The proposal mostly makes its purpose clear and how it is going to be implemented. It would have been interesting however to have more examples of what the miro page will contain in order to have a clearer vision of what the community would get out of the funds.

For such a simple project, it would be very simple to audit, which is to check that Miro board is ready after 3 months. I personally believe this would be ready in even less time. There is no risk or challenge associated.

solution: Create a one-page Miro guideline board to introduce the Discord server and its members
